title: What is the relationship between love, sex, and the Demiurge in occult philosophy?
first_phrase: This text explores the concept of love and sexuality as tools for the Demiurge to maintain control over humanity, as described in Hermann Hesse's novel "Demian." The last 200 tokens delve into the idea of transmuting sexual energy rather than suppressing it, with reference to Hindu practices. The author also touches on the esoteric notion of the "hidden woman" within man, as depicted in alchemical and mythological traditions. Overall, the text examines the conflict between individuality and conformity in the quest for spiritual liberation.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the concept of transmutation and the esoteric notion of the hidden woman within oneself are essential in understanding the practice of Vajroli-mudra in Tantra. The Gnostic idea of opposing forces in a union emphasizes the importance of activating the internal forces for a fruitful and fulfilling union. Without delving into the internal mystery, external actions become a meaningless endeavor. Remember, elements cannot be destroyed but only transformed.
